title: Stringent upper limit on the direct 3alpha decay of the Hoyle state in 12C

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Physical Review Letters, Vol.110, p.152502 (2013)

x4codes.hlp: Triangle Universities Nuclear Lab., Durham, NC, United States of America

x4freetext: Experiment performed at the HIgS
facility at TUNL
Gas mixture of CO2 (80%) + N2 (20%) at pressure of
100 torr in sensitive volume of the optical time
projection chamber with dimensions of 30 x 30 x 21 cm3.
Time projection chamber with working gas mixture
serving at the same time as reaction target.
Ionization electrons drift towards a double
parallel-grid avalanche multiplier, yielding charge
multiplication and light emission. Avalanche-induced
photons from N2 emission are collected, intensified
and recorded with a Charge Coupled Device (CCD)
camera, providing two-dimensional track images. The
event`s time projection (third coordinate) and the
deposited energy are recorded by photomultipliers and
by the TPC charge-signal, respectively. Detector has
nearly 100 % efficiency and negligible background.
Nearly monoenergetic gamma-rays were produced
by Compton backscattering of photons of the
free-electron laser. Beams of circularly polarized
gamma rays with energies between 9.1 and 10.7 MeV
were used with energy spreads of 300-350 keV and
on-target intensities of 2E+8 photons/sec.
Compiled by S.H.
From measured total width of 10.025 MeV state and
3 alpha particle decay width ratio, an upper limit on
3 alpha decay of Hoyle state was determined from
R-matrix theory, which gives relation of width and
penetrability of a state. Three alpha penetrability
ratios were calculated using Monte Carlo code with
WKB approximation.
Data taken from text p.3 of the reference

x4headers.headerHelp: Upper limit of quantity specified under REACTION
